author: Allen, James Lane
title: The Emblems of Fidelity: A Comedy in Letters
plot: The story is told through a series of letters between two friends, John and Robert. John is a wealthy businessman who is in love with a woman named Mary. Robert, who is also in love with Mary, writes John letters pretending to be Mary, leading John to believe that Mary is in love with him. The letters become increasingly absurd, with Mary claiming to be in love with a variety of different men, including a Frenchman and a poet. Eventually, John discovers the truth and confronts Robert, but the two friends are able to reconcile.

plot: The story is told through a series of letters between two friends, John and Robert. John is a wealthy businessman who is in love with a woman named Mary. Robert, who is also in love with Mary, writes John letters pretending to be Mary, leading John to believe that Mary is in love with him. The letters become increasingly absurd, with Mary claiming to be in love with a variety of different men, including a Frenchman and a poet. Eventually, John discovers the truth and confronts Robert, but the two friends are able to reconcile.

author: Bashford, H. H. (Henry Howarth), Sir
title: The Corner of Harley Street
plot: The novel is written in the form of letters between various characters, including the protagonist, Dr. Peter Harding. The letters detail the personal and professional lives of the characters, including their relationships, medical cases, and social engagements. The novel is set in the medical community of Harley Street in London, and it deals with themes of love, ambition, and the challenges of practicing medicine.

The letters detail the personal and professional lives of the characters, including their relationships, medical cases, and social engagements. The novel is set in the medical community of Harley Street in London, and it deals with themes of love, ambition, and the challenges of practicing medicine.
